New Records: Rachin Ravindra went past 500 runs in the World Cup with a 94-ball 108.
Key Match Events: Fakhar Zaman scored 126 not out when the game was called off.
Rachin Ravindra scored his third ton of the World Cup with a 94-ball 108.
New Zealand posted a commanding 401-6 from 50 overs.
Pakistan were 160-1 in the 21st over when rain brought a stoppage.
Pakistan were declared winners as they were ahead of the required rate with a revised target of 342 off 41 overs.
Fakhar Zaman completed his 11th ODI hundred, and first in a World Cup, with a six and a single off Mitchell Santner.
Mohammad Wasim took 3 wickets for 60 runs.
Post-Match Reflections: Pakistan skipper Babar Azam praised Fakhar Zaman and mentioned the importance of their partnership.
Babar Azam reflected on the team's momentum and their positive approach for the remainder of the tournament.
Kane Williamson acknowledged Fakhar Zaman's exceptional performance and expressed a desire to take positives into the next match.
Miscellaneous Highlights: The match was rain-hit and ended prematurely.
Pakistan and New Zealand both have eight points and remain in contention for semifinal spots.
India and South Africa have already secured two of the semifinal places.
Pakistan needs to win their last match against England and hope New Zealand loses to Sri Lanka or the match is hit by rain.
